With your donation, we can make online shopping fun, reliable, and inclusive.

 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t donate to our campaign, here are some other options for you to support swatchcandy:
1. Follow us on Instagram at @swatchcandy
2. Sign up for our newsletter at www.swatchcandy.com
3. Tell your friends about us to build up the excitement!
We’d like to thank all of you for the love, support, and donations towards this project, and we hope to provide you all with the best experience upon swatchcandy’s release!

story:
THE CAUSE

Muse Group, a registered 501c3 non-profit organization, created Callia in 2015 to empower low-income women in the Ivory Coast to earn a competitive wage through ethically sourced and produced jewelry. Currently, Callia supports 80 women suppliers and artisans. 

We need your help to sustain these 80 women, and to invest in growth. Help us triple our impact in 2018. Together we can empower 240 women supporting 1,200 family members!

Here's how:
1. Pick your favorite jewelry from our perks.
2. Make your contribution. 
3. Get your jewelry delivered in time for the holidays.

CALLIA’S APPROACH

ORGANIC MATERIALS

Callia sources distinctive organic materials, including seeds, shells and fibers, from village women’s associations. We train the associations to work more efficiently, saving them time while increasing their earnings. Currently, 60 women suppliers currently earn a 50-150% premium for their goods.

ETHICAL JEWELRY EMPOWERING WOMEN

Organic materials are brought to Muse Group’s Workshop in Abidjan, where they are transformed into jewelry by our team of artisans. These women receive training in jewelry making and design, and supported to track their performance against professional development goals. Currently 20 women artisans earn a competitive wage plus commissions.

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

We are not yet operating at scale. Our overhead costs are high, and we need critical operating funds to ensure we can sustain our existing team as well build our client base. To do that, we also need to invest in growth. 

Your contribution will empower us to sustain our 80-woman team, and invest in growth to triple our impact in 2018!

WHAT WILL YOU GET IN RETURN?

Get jewelry from our brand new Warrior Queen collection, delivered anywhere worldwide in time for the holidays! (For more detailed photos, see our gallery, where you'll also find "How To Wear It" videos that show all the different ways to wear our multi-function pieces.)

THE DESIGNER

Jessica Antista is an adventure seeker, designer and social entrepreneur who has worked for 12 years to help build sustainable African businesses that create jobs for poor people.

After 10 years of designing and managing development projects across 20 African countries, Jessica started Muse Group and its Callia ethical jewelry brand to empower disadvantaged women in the Ivory Coast, West Africa, to benefit from the rise of the ethical fashion industry.

PARTNERSHIPS

While Jessica loves wandering African markets and exploring remote villages by bush taxi, she knew that this was no way to run a business. So she created partnerships with world class development and humanitarian organizations, CARE International (CARE) and The International Rescue Committee (IRC). Working with these organizations’ existing projects, which are training disadvantaged women to form savings and credit associations, Muse Group targeted existing groups of women trained and selected by CARE and IRC’s field staff, to ensure their commitment and motivation.

WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?

We’ve accomplished a lot, but we need to invest to grow. We will triple our impact in 2018 by establishing new material supply chains, training new suppliers and artisans, and building a professional management team, to ensure that our systems can keep up with demand. 

CAMPAIGN BUDGET

FAQ

When and where will you deliver?

Jewelry will be delivered by December 15 to all US addresses, and by December 20 to non-US addresses. We can deliver anywhere in the world! Shipping costs will be calculated when you pay for your perk, based on your shipping address.

Is my contribution tax deductible?

Muse Group is a registered US 501c3 non-profit organization. All purchases and donations are fully tax deductible.

What will Muse Group/Callia do with the money raised?

The funds raised will be used to establish additional supply chains that will train and mobilize 120 new rural women suppliers. Further, they will support the growth of Callia’s artisan team by 40 members, expanding its urban internship program and doubling the number of employee artisans within one year. Finally, funds will be invested to strengthen Callia’s management systems, hiring an accountant and a stock manager, to ensure that we manage this growth effectively.

How are Callia’s women suppliers and artisans paid? How can I be sure these women will benefit directly from my contribution?

Callia respects Fair Trade principals, and creating economic opportunities for low-income women is at the heart of our mission. Based on these principals, Callia works with 3 categories of artisans. Currently 50% of our artisans are employees, 10% are interns and 40% are freelancers.

A permanent team of full-time artisan employees is paid the legal Ivory Coast minimum wage, plus a monthly commission based on the number of pieces produced meeting quality standards. These employees are fully declared and receive retirement and disability benefits.

Artisan interns earn a monthly stipend in line with prevailing market rates, to cover the cost of transportation and meals. All intern training and material expenses are covered by Callia. Based on performance, Callia seeks to transition as many interns as possible to full-time employment, in keeping with the growth of Callia’s sales.

Artisan freelancers are independent artisans who work with us on a purchase order basis, and are engaged only when we have a large volume of orders. Freelancers are paid based on a pre-negotiated purchase order, for which the price of each piece or component produced is defined in advance with the agreement of the freelancer.

Callia’s materials suppliers are paid based on purchase orders, using a price premium defined in advance and agreed upon with each supplier group. The price premium is based on the prevailing market price for these materials, plus 53-150%, depending on the material.

Where can I see more detailed photos of the jewelry?

Please check out our gallery (click on the tiles underneath our video at the top of this page) for more detailed photos of the jewelry offered in each perk, including multiple views. You can also watch our “How to Wear It” videos to see all the ways to wear our convertible bracelets and pendants. Get inspired!

What about sizing?

All bracelets are size medium, 7.5in/19cm.

All pendant necklaces come with a matching classic cord, which is 30in/76cm long and can be worn multiple lengths by doubling the cord. See all the ways to wear it in our video series in our gallery.

Body jewelry is one-size-fits-all, with a 2-inch extender chain on all clasps, to enable adjustment:

1. Long brown seed body chain: Length: (each side) 45in, 29in/115cm, 73cm
2. Brown seed shoulder chain: Neck: Adjustable 32-33in/80-83.5cm. Fits shoulders up to 43in/110cm. Drop: (shoulder) 7in /17cm
3. Short black seed body chain: Length: (side) 33in/84cm, Width: (back) 10-12in/25-30cm

Does Callia accept returns or exchanges?

While Callia cannot process refunds at this time, it can accept return of Perks merchandise in return for credit on our e-commerce site, www.Callia.Shop, which will be live by the end of October, 2017. The customer is responsible for the cost of return shipping. Once received in our warehouse, the returned merchandise will be credited at the Perk value less shipping, minus Indiegogo and credit card fees (8%).

Why can't I select the quantity of pieces that I want? What if I want to order more than 1 of something? 

While you can not change the number of items in a perk, you can order more than 1 of the same perk. For example, if you would like to order 2 pairs of earrings, select "The Able Advocate" perk and complete the checkout process, then repeat! Select and pay for the perk a second time to add the second pair. Same goes for bracelets. Want 2? Select and pay for "The Conscientious Contributor" perk, then repeat!

I’m having trouble selecting my earrings, what do I do?

During checkout, you will be prompted to choose your earring style for each pair included in the package. The options are numbered, to correspond to the photo shown on the perk, and a brief description is provided, for reference.

For The Able Advocate and The Choosy Champion, you should choose only 1 pair of earrings during checkout! Choose your favorite pair, then select the corresponding option in its respective category, which corresponds to the row within the photo where your chosen pair appears. For all other rows, select “None in this row”. Note: If you mistakenly choose more pairs of earrings than are included in your perk, we will do our best to contact you to ascertain your preference, but we cannot guarantee that the volume of orders will permit us to do this. Otherwise, we will choose 1 pair for you from those that you selected, based on what we have in stock.

For The Gutsy Gift Giver and The Holiday Hunter, you should select 2 and 3 pairs of earrings, respectively. You will be given one drop down for each pair of earrings to be selected. We have done our best to provide combinations that are as comprehensive as possible, but if you would like a combination of earrings that is not possible within the checkout parameters, please follow the selection instructions as above, and send an email to Jessica@musegroup.org to request a perk modification. We will do our best to honor these requests, as the volume of orders received permits.
story_txt: THE CAUSEMuse Group, a registered 501c3 non-profit organization, created Callia in 2015 to empower low-income women in the Ivory Coast to earn a competitive wage through ethically sourced and produced jewelry. Currently, Callia supports 80 women suppliers and artisans. We need your help to sustain these 80 women, and to invest in growth. Help us triple our impact in 2018. Together we can empower 240 women supporting 1,200 family members!Here's how:1. Pick your favorite jewelry from our perks.2. Make your contribution. 3. Get your jewelry delivered in time for the holidays.CALLIA’S APPROACHORGANIC MATERIALSCallia sources distinctive organic materials, including seeds, shells and fibers, from village women’s associations. We train the associations to work more efficiently, saving them time while increasing their earnings. Currently, 60 women suppliers currently earn a 50-150% premium for their goods.ETHICAL JEWELRY EMPOWERING WOMENOrganic materials are brought to Muse Group’s Workshop in Abidjan, where they are transformed into jewelry by our team of artisans. These women receive training in jewelry making and design, and supported to track their performance against professional development goals. Currently 20 women artisans earn a competitive wage plus commissions.WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?We are not yet operating at scale. Our overhead costs are high, and we need critical operating funds to ensure we can sustain our existing team as well build our client base. To do that, we also need to invest in growth. Your contribution will empower us to sustain our 80-woman team, and invest in growth to triple our impact in 2018!WHAT WILL YOU GET IN RETURN?Get jewelry from our brand new Warrior Queen collection, delivered anywhere worldwide in time for the holidays! (For more detailed photos, see our gallery, where you'll also find "How To Wear It" videos that show all the different ways to wear our multi-function pieces.)THE DESIGNERJessica Antista is an adventure seeker, designer and social entrepreneur who has worked for 12 years to help build sustainable African businesses that create jobs for poor people.After 10 years of designing and managing development projects across 20 African countries, Jessica started Muse Group and its Callia ethical jewelry brand to empower disadvantaged women in the Ivory Coast, West Africa, to benefit from the rise of the ethical fashion industry.PARTNERSHIPSWhile Jessica loves wandering African markets and exploring remote villages by bush taxi, she knew that this was no way to run a business. So she created partnerships with world class development and humanitarian organizations, CARE International (CARE) and The International Rescue Committee (IRC). Working with these organizations’ existing projects, which are training disadvantaged women to form savings and credit associations, Muse Group targeted existing groups of women trained and selected by CARE and IRC’s field staff, to ensure their commitment and motivation.WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?We’ve accomplished a lot, but we need to invest to grow. We will triple our impact in 2018 by establishing new material supply chains, training new suppliers and artisans, and building a professional management team, to ensure that our systems can keep up with demand. CAMPAIGN BUDGETFAQWhen and where will you deliver?Jewelry will be delivered by December 15 to all US addresses, and by December 20 to non-US addresses. We can deliver anywhere in the world! Shipping costs will be calculated when you pay for your perk, based on your shipping address.Is my contribution tax deductible? Muse Group is a registered US 501c3 non-profit organization. All purchases and donations are fully tax deductible.What will Muse Group/Callia do with the money raised? The funds raised will be used to establish additional supply chains that will train and mobilize 120 new rural women suppliers. Further, they will support the growth of Callia’s artisan team by 40 members, expanding its urban internship program and doubling the number of employee artisans within one year. Finally, funds will be invested to strengthen Callia’s management systems, hiring an accountant and a stock manager, to ensure that we manage this growth effectively.How are Callia’s women suppliers and artisans paid? story:
Designer rentals are not just for celebrities and their stylists anymore. 

DWTN LUSH makes it easy for women to experiment with a variety of designer shoe brands and decide which style they want to invest in. Need a shoe that sparkles for your wedding, Gala, or just a night out on the town? Whatever the need, you’re just a hop, skip and click away from luxury with DWTN LUSH. Renting is made simple: Customers choose from designer footwear they love, select a size, rent an item for up to five days, and then return it. 

 

 

A hop, skip and click away from luxury.

With $15,000 you can help contribute to the launching of the DWTN LUSH brand and allow real women everywhere to experience luxury.  We plan to use the funding for:

•Shipping and packaging materials

•Inventory

•App Creation

•Dry cleaning services

•create awareness and passion for the brand.

•Website maintenance.

 

What We Need & What You Get

You support will enable us to refine the business by building clientele through marketing. We're looking for contributions to obtain packaging for our shoes and complete a website that is fully functioning with features specifically designed for e-commerce.

A portion of the funds will be used to create awareness and passion for the brand through pop-up shops, networking events across the U.S, and advertisement. So far, we’ve obtained a small inventory from world renowned brands, but with your help we can increase our shoe catalog. For the future, we hope to get high-end shoe designers involved directly; therefore, the more people who are using the service, the more designer brands available for rent. 

 

Better than the rest.

What sets us apart from other designer rental services is that we plan to incorporate an app that allows woman to sell and rent their own designer shoes to woman within their community.   This will allow others to obtain luxury shoes within 24 hours or less of payment as well as give other women the opportunity to have their own small business.  The app will make luxury footwear more accessible and create a fashion sharing culture around the world.  

 

Women are only wearing 1/4 of the shoes they’re purchasing. 

I’m especially motivated to grow the company because, with each new customer, we’re eliminating wastefulness of shoes that would’ve likely been used very little or not at all.   I am driven to make these goals a reality when I think of the millions of women that would benefit and all of the material we could conserve. When the benefits are so tangible, I feel it is my obligation to make it happen. It's time for a fashion revolution. Help make it a reality!

 

Risks & Challenges

 

1. There is a challenge in building up inventory because we don’t want to have too much on our hands with no one to buy it. It will be on us to ensure that we have enough customers committed to pre-sale so that we don’t end up in a ditch too deep to climb out of. 

2. Lastly, the finalizing of the service generally takes ~12 months of time to create, but can vary based on a number of factors including large quantity of shoes to ship, the amount of employees executing shipment, etc.

 

Although there will be many risks and challenges to renting high end footwear we are confident in our ability to achieve our goal of becoming one of the largest designer shoe rental services and we plan to take production slow to ensure that you receive the best experience possible with the brand.  That may mean tweaking, adding, or removing small features.  

 

Can't help financially?

That's okay! If you still love the idea and the passion behind it - I'D LOVE YOUR SUPPORT!

Tell my story to friends, share my posts on social media, hand out buttons.  Whatever it takes.   I just thank you for being interested in my dream.

story:
Why I started Ella Bella Grey

I am Elsa Turnbull and I founded Ella Bella Grey to make pretty, comfortable underthings for women of a certain age.

As I am certainly a woman of a certain age (54 and counting), my patience has run out with ill-fitting, padded, wired and uncomfortable bras. My impression is that bras are designed with the 14 to 35 age group in mind.

With the help of a patternmaker, the prototype has taken a year to perfect, and it is the bra I have always wished I could buy.

 

How this bra is different

 

Cut higher under the arms to eliminate underarm bulge or side boob (as it is affectionately known).

Broader band which adds comfort and support as well as minimizing the under band roll.

Broader wings and a hook and eye closure. Not only does this smooth out your back it also means you don't have to wrestle your bralette on over your head. Having a closure with three rows of eyes gives you more control over fit and longevity than a bralette.

Wider straps give better support and are more comfortable over the shoulders.

Eliminates quad boob or breast spill because the upper cup lays gently on the skin.

Designed to move the bust forward, away from the under the arms.

Gives good support and a natural shape without using underwires or padding. 

Made from organic cotton and Oeko-Tex lace and silk allowing us to adhere to sustainable, ethical principles.

Simplified sizing to make it easy to accurately find your size online.

 

This is the comfortable, simple, everyday (or night) bra you have been looking for too!

 

 

Why Fund Ella Bella Grey

The idea to make a simple, comfortable and pretty bra percolated in my brain for years, and in January of 2018, I decided that it was time to be brave and take the plunge, engage a pattern maker and start the process. Read the blog here...

More than a year later and we are ready, with your support, to start manufacturing, eventually offering this design in 7 different fabric and colour choices. We will launch with black and ecru versions and at regular intervals add the next colourway, adding more options every few months. Our bras will not be seasonal; if you find a few you love, more will be waiting when it is time to replace them.

You can send your well worn and loved bra back to us when it is time for a replacement, and we will recycle it for you.

The only way we can make this real is through your financial support. Take a look at our perks as we are confident there is something to entice you.

Ella Bella Grey will launch in the United Kingdom and then, if possible, replicate in the European Union, the United States, and Australia. Doing this will allow us to source sustainable textiles and manufacture where we sell, thereby keeping the footprint small and staying true to our ethos of sustainability.

 

Thank you for your support!

Please help us by donating to our crowdfunding campaign and help us spread the word. Tell someone you know so that they can tell someone else. Share a link to this crowdfunding campaign on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter. The more women hear about Ella Bella Grey, the more successful our campaign will be. 

I have modeled, acted, developed new business for a staffing firm, and worked in healthcare, but the one thing I have done most consistently, for the longest period of time, is wear a bra! Therefore, I can unequivocally say, this bra is a pretty comfortable underthing!
